dillon.gameAPI.security

Class SecuritySystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • dillon.gameAPI.security.SecuritySystem

  • public class SecuritySystem
extends java.lang.Object
    This class keeps track of all sensitive actions and stops them if necessary.
    Since:
    V1.13
    Author:
    Dillon - Github dg092099.github.io

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  SecuritySystem.engineSecurityHandler
      The engine security handler, registered engine security handlers would be called when a sensitive action is requested to run.

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public static SecurityKey init()
        Used internally to activate module.
        Returns:
        The engine master key.

      • getGameKey

        public static SecurityKey getGameKey()
        Gets the game's master key. Can be called only once. Even if you don't use the security features, still get the key to lockout this method, so someone else can't.
        Returns:
        The key.

      • checkPermission

        public static void checkPermission(SecurityKey k,
                                   RequestedAction ra)
        Called internally to check the permissions.
        Parameters:
        k - The key given.
        ra - The action requested to execute.

      • addHandler

        public static void addHandler(SecuritySystem.engineSecurityHandler h,
                              SecurityKey k)
        This adds a engine security handler to the system. The key must be the engine or game key.
        Parameters:
        h - The handler.
        k - The key

      • disableSecurity

        public static void disableSecurity(SecurityKey k)
        This disables the security measures. Must use the game key.
        Parameters:
        k - The key.

      • enableSecurity

        public static void enableSecurity(SecurityKey k)
        This enables the security measures. Must use the game key.
        Parameters:
        k - The key

      • createSecurityKey

        public static SecurityKey createSecurityKey(SecurityKey k,
                                            java.lang.String description)
        This creates a valid security key.
        Parameters:
        k - The security key as a security measure.
        description - The description.
        Returns:
        A key

        public static boolean isEngineKey(SecurityKey k)
